Title.evidence: Biomechanical Analysis of Short-Stem Total Hip Arthroplasty in Revision Scenarios: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Intervention.evidence: A metaphyseal anchoring SHA (Tri-Lock BPS) stem and a standard THA (Corail) stem were implanted

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether a short stem can provide adequate primary stability in revision total hip arthroplasty (THA) scenarios.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the 3D micromotion, measured immediately after implantation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant differences in 3D micromotions were observed between the short and standard stems at most test points, except at the lateral point of the distal femur (P5: Tri-Lock BPS 32.9 ± 7.54 μm vs. Corail 25.1 ± 4.32 μm; p = 0.011)
